message.content:
cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with hand gesture recognition using skeleton-based motion features. It also involves the use of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. Additionally, the paper focuses on human-computer interaction (cs.HC) which is closely related to computer vision. The use of RNNs also suggests that the paper may belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also involves the use of motion features (cs.MM) which is a common technique in computer vision for capturing temporal information. Finally, the use of neural networks for classification suggests that the paper may belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
